Preprocess single-cell data

Source: R/preprocessing.R
preprocess_data.Rd

Performs standard preprocessing steps on a Seurat object including normalization, variable feature selection, and scaling. This function implements the standard Seurat workflow for single-cell RNA-seq data preprocessing.

Usage

preprocess_data(
  seurat_obj,
  n_features = 2000,
  scale_factor = 10000,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

seurat_obj

Seurat object. The Seurat object to preprocess.

n_features

Integer. Number of variable features to select (default: 2000). These are the most informative genes that will be used for downstream analysis.

scale_factor

Numeric. Scale factor for data scaling (default: 10000). This is used in the normalization step to scale the data to a common total.

verbose

Logical. Whether to print progress messages (default: TRUE).

Value

A processed Seurat object containing:

  • Normalized data in the data slot

  • Scaled data in the scale.data slot

  • Variable features identified and stored in the object

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Normalizes the data using LogNormalize method

  2. Identifies variable features using the vst method

  3. Scales the data for all genes

The normalization step:

  • Normalizes the gene expression values for each cell

  • Uses a scale factor of 10,000 by default

  • Applies a log transformation

The variable feature selection:

  • Uses the vst method to identify highly variable genes

  • Selects the top 2000 genes by default

  • These genes are used for downstream analysis

The scaling step:

  • Centers and scales the data

  • Makes genes comparable across cells

  • Prepares data for dimensionality reduction

See also

load_data for loading the data reduce_dimensions for dimensionality reduction

Examples

# Example with mock Seurat object
library(Seurat)
# Create minimal mock data
counts <- matrix(rpois(1000, 5), nrow = 100)
rownames(counts) <- paste0("Gene", seq_len(100))
colnames(counts) <- paste0("Cell", seq_len(10))
metadata <- data.frame(
    row.names = colnames(counts),
    condition = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 5)
)
seurat_obj <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = counts, meta.data = metadata)
#> Warning: Data is of class matrix. Coercing to dgCMatrix.

# Preprocess the data
processed_obj <- preprocess_data(
    seurat_obj,
    normalization_method = "LogNormalize"
)
#> Error in preprocess_data(seurat_obj, normalization_method = "LogNormalize"): unused argument (normalization_method = "LogNormalize")
